node.title: Lawyer for Man Accused of Killing Ahmaud Arbery Draws Scrutiny
node.description: Kevin Gough argued that the Rev. Al Sharpton’s presence in court was intimidating to the jury. “We don’t want any more Black pastors coming in here,” he said.

node.title: Ex-NBA Player Apologizes After Daughter Punches Opponent at Game, Police Report Filed
node.description: "I am praying for your complete healing both physically and emotionally," said former Bulls player Corey Benjamin in the statement.

node.title: Car Crashes Into Man's Home Following Police Chase: 'Don't Shoot Me, I Am the Homeowner'
node.description: A man was asleep on his couch in Cleveland Heights, Ohio, when a vehicle being pursued by police crashed into his home early Friday morning.

node.title: Professor Visiting Los Angeles Repels Armed Robber With Kung Fu, Loses $3,100, Police Say
node.description: "I felt scared after the incident. Generally speaking, I don't suggest the public copy my actions. I have learned martial arts before," Pigai said.

node.title: Tiananmen statue creator asks for immunity from Hong Kong security law

node.title: Two boaties rescued after boat sinks in Wellington Harbour
node.description: Two people have been rescued from Wellington Harbour after their boat sunk near Somes Island.

node.title: Meadows fails to appear before January 6 select committee

node.title: Homer Plessy’s Arrest in 1892 Led to a Landmark Ruling. Now He May Get Justice.
node.description: His legacy is tied to a Supreme Court decision that upheld the “separate but equal” doctrine, underpinning laws that segregated and disenfranchised African Americans for decades.

node.title: Many migrants in Belarus flew there. Airlines on Friday moved to end that practice.
node.description: Some airlines have agreed to stop taking Iraqi, Syrian and Yemeni citizens to Minsk, which the E.U. hopes will stem the flow of migrants to the bloc’s borders.

node.title: 2 Ivory Smugglers Captured in International Operation, U.S. Says
node.description: The undercover joint operation by the U.S. and Congolese governments also resulted in the seizure of millions of dollars’ worth of illegal wildlife plunder.

node.title: Haiti Gang Leader Allows Fuel Deliveries for Week, Won't Again Until Prime Minister Resigns
node.description: G9 blocked entry into the terminal where fuel is stored and allocated last month, prompting a growing national crisis in the capital city of Port-au-Prince.

node.title: Joe Manchin Says Robert Califf as FDA Commissioner Will 'Take Us Backwards, Not Forward'
node.description: Dr. Robert Califf's nomination as FDA commissioner has been twice opposed by Sen. Joe Manchin. Manchin instead is calling for a culture change at the FDA.

node.title: Fury Spreads as Gavin Newsom Extends Emergency Powers for 4 More Months After Being Sued
node.description: California legislator Kevin Kiley said the governor's continuous state of emergency "is completely lawless."

node.title: Delegate Says Russia is Lone Holdout in Agreeing to U.S. Hosting 2023 Asia-Pacific Forum
node.description: Russia refused to allow the U.S. to host "unless some of its diplomats are removed from a U.S. blacklist or allowed to enter the U.S. to participate."

node.title: Redditors Weigh in on Phrases That Can Set off a Fanbase in Viral Post
node.description: "The fans and players were crying. I've never seen that in any sport ever," said one commenter about Brazil's World Cup loss to Germany in 2014.

node.title: Inland NSW towns brace for major flooding
node.description: Residents of the New South Wales towns of Forbes, Cowra, Nanami and Cotton's Weir are being urged to prepare for major floods as heavy rain and dam overflow makes its way down the the Lachlan River in the state's Central West.

node.title: Holiday home rental prices are skyrocketing. Would you pay $22,000 a week?
node.description: The cost of accommodation along parts of the New South Wales South Coast reach dizzying heights, with property owners taking advantage of Sydney's exodus after the lifting of COVID travel restrictions.

node.title: Fire crews battle forestry block blaze in Canterbury
node.description: A large blaze at a forestry block north of Christchurch is being fought by 24 fire crews.

node.title: DOC exploring Covid-19 vaccine requirements for trampers

node.title: Motorcyclist dies in Marlborough
node.description: A motorcyclist has died in a crash in Renwick this morning.

node.title: Top CDC official said migrant expulsion was not needed to contain COVID

node.title: How Kyrsten Sinema Uses Clothing to Signal Her Social Class
node.description: The senator is trying to play many roles in Washington at once.

node.title: Ex-‘Apprentice’ Contestant Drops Defamation Lawsuit Against Trump
node.description: Summer Zervos accused former President Donald J. Trump of sexual assault and sued him after he said she was lying.

node.title: Migrant Crisis in Belarus Tests Putin’s Uneasy Alliance With Lukashenko
node.description: Last year Vladimir V. Putin helped save Aleksandr G. Lukashenko’s Belarusian regime. But Russia now has an ever-more-erratic ally and risks entanglement in a dangerous crisis.

node.title: U.S. Won't Reopen Afghan Embassy, Qatar Agrees to Provide Services to Americans in Region
node.description: Qatar has agreed to represent the U.S. in Afghanistan, promising to open a U.S. interests section in the Qatari Embassy in Kabul.

node.title: Lender charges 200% interest to military families who pawn wares, CFPB says
node.description: FirstCash allegedly made more than 3,600 loans, all of which carried interest rates higher than law's 36% threshold.

node.title: Former Raiders coach Jon Gruden sues the NFL and Roger Goodell
node.description: In the suit, Gruden accuses the NFL and Goodell of "a Soviet-style character assassination."

node.title: How Can I Channel My Inner 1930s Movie Star?
node.description: A reader asks for guidance on finding glamorous loungewear.

node.title: Spears’s lawyer is pushing for the singer’s father to be investigated.
node.description: Mathew S. Rosengart, Spears’s lawyer, has accused James P. Spears of financial mismanagement, along with the estate’s former business manager, Tri Star Sports & Entertainment Group.

node.title: In France, Kamala Harris Asserts Herself as a Diplomatic Asset
node.description: The vice president met with President Emmanuel Macron of France, skirting recent U.S.-French tensions, and immersed herself in issues like Libya and cybersecurity.

node.title: NBA Memo Directs Coaches, Players Not to Wait on COVID-19 Booster Shots
node.description: Despite a 97 percent vaccination rate among players, the NBA is experiencing an increase in COVID-19 infections.

node.title: Outgoing Arkansas Governor Endorses Ex-Trump Press Secretary Sarah Sanders to Replace Him
node.description: "Sarah has earned the Republican nomination and I'm delighted today to endorse her for governor," Governor Asa Hutchinson said in a statement.

node.title: Britney Spears No Longer 'Overprotected' as Conservatorship Ends for Pop Singer
node.description: Los Angeles County Superior Court Judge Brenda Penny's decision comes five months after the Grammy-award winner spoke out publicly about her experiences.

node.title: Jon Gruden Sues NFL for 'Malicious and Orchestrated Campaign', Says Resignation Was Forced
node.description: Gruden resigned as the Raiders head coach after emails were leaked, which showed him using racist and homophobic language.

node.title: Two Teens Formally Charged With First-Degree Murder in Death of School Teacher

node.title: As GOP Uses Border Against Biden, EU Conservatives Eye Same Strategy With Belarus
node.description: "For better for worse, these types of crises tend to influence the outcomes of elections across the European Union," Erol Yayboke told Newsweek.

node.title: 11 Weeks Until Winter Olympics, Some U.S. Athletes Still Unsure How They'll Get to China
node.description: No flights to Beijing are out of North America, leaving U.S. athletes to charter connecting flights that could double their travel times to China.

node.title: Man who flew from WA to Canberra to 'flog' Treasurer Josh Frydenberg has charges dismissed
node.description: A man who told security staff at Parliament House that he had travelled from Western Australia to Canberra to "flog" Treasurer Josh Frydenberg has all charges against him dismissed.

node.title: How a maths equation helped spark Kevin Sheedy's remarkable Australian rules career
node.description: Sheedy won multiple premierships as a player and coach, and shaped the game that exists today, but he could have easily been lost to cricket in his younger days.

node.title: Victoria records 1,221 new local COVID-19 cases and four deaths
node.description: There are now 16,671 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 407 people have died in the state during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Decades-old debate takes a new turn following fatal shark attack at metropolitan Perth beach

node.title: Government's emissions reduction modelling draws researchers' criticism, industry approval

node.title: Netherlands Bans Fans From Stadiums in New Partial Lockdown Amid Surge in COVID Cases

node.title: 14 Sue Maker of Capital Gains Slot Game After 'Bug' Led to Smaller Prize Payout
node.description: "This error caused the patron(s) to believe that their bonus round winnings were higher than the actual winnings," a New Jersey deputy attorney general said.

node.title: North Dakota Senate Bans Teaching Critical Race Theory in Schools, Says Action Preemptive

node.title: National says MIQ for Covid-free returnees 'perversion of priorities'

node.title: As virus lingers, teacher shortages shut schools across U.S.

node.title: New York to Stop Accepting Applications for Pandemic Rental Aid
node.description: Officials said demand for the pandemic relief program was “far outstripping” available funds. Gov. Kathy Hochul has asked the federal government for almost $1 billion more.

node.title: The number of U.S. workers quitting their jobs in September was the highest on record.

node.title: Clip of Dunkin' Customer Taking Money From Tip Jar Over Incorrect Order Viewed 2.5M Times
node.description: "You stole my tips!" exclaimed the employee. Replied the customer: "I sure did, because you won't give me my refund."

node.title: Environment lawyers detect 'legal error' in NT government's secret water licence plan

node.title: Scott Morrison now shares the same ambition on emissions reduction as Queensland's Labor government. Here's why that's awkward

node.title: As atmospheric rivers become more likely, so do floods

node.description: There are more than 500 unplanned power outages across Victoria, and a major flood warning has been issued for the Mitchell River at Bairnsdale.
